intro: Jasione sphaerocephala, commonly known as the globe-headed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spherical flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are blue to violet in color, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Jasione sphaerocephala is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
